message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE. 

The paper discusses a method for sentence matching in Question Answering systems, which is a common task in natural language processing. The use of a multi-task learning model and a connected graph to represent sentence relations suggests that the paper may fall under the category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL). The implementation of a semantic retrieval framework also indicates a focus on information retrieval (cs.IR) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of machine learning techniques for sentence matching and intent classification further supports the possibility of categorizing the paper under Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE).
